name: Deadlings: Rotten Edition
description: Arcade side-scroller with strategy elements! Four different types of zombie minions with unique abilities! 70 levels of pure zombie gore fun! Additional game mode - Nightmare - only for the hardcore gamers!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo 1.8 Ghz or equivalent Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 9400M 256MB DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 1500 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX compatible

reviews.review_text: this is a fun game, it has nice visuals, its quirk, but thoser have blood. this isn't really a platformer, but instead a bit more of an action puzzle game like portal you control diffrent types of zombies, diffrent levels will give diffrent types of zombies, which are required to beat the level. the zombies are always moving,except for the last one you get, and they can turn if they a spring or for the flying one, a wall. the controls aren't bad, although i do find the flying one the worst to control due to very slight delay for starting to propel up. lv 40 and onwards really makes it annoying  but,its still a fun game to play i recommend getting this game
Very nice puzzle game! On normal it can be very easy, but on hardcore it is very hard! Nice Work Guys! I'm waiting for next game but at first make some new chapters! :D
Fun game, and the nightmare levels are very challenging. Havent passed all the bonus levels, only two left. I enjoyed it a lot. I`ll recommend it.

The art style and soundtrack are cool, and the gameplay is pretty good, but it's too impractical to be a paid game. It seems more like something you'd play on kongregate when you got a couple of hours to kill. Figuring out a level takes about 1 minute, and then it's just hoping you don't screw up the platforming (And if you're playing on nigtmare or going for all brains, Morgan Freeman bless you.) The levels go one at a time, so if you're stuck, you can't do anything, unlike games like Super Meat Boy where if you're stuck, you at least have another level to play.   Overall, the concept is cool, the art and soundtrack were pretty good, but the gameplay was executed poorly.  5/10

All the idiots who compared this to Super Meat Boy should be vivisected with a fondue fork and it is shameful of the devs to quote not one but two reviews who use this comparison which makes no sense whatsoever.  The game has ONE thing going for it, the artstyle is nice and it looks good overall, but past that, it's a tedious platformer without the most basic element of a platformer: Control. The zombies move automatically which leaves you with 2 decisions: which direction to start running and when to jump, which makes for a fairly unpleasant experience.  All in all, not worth my time and energy.
